articles.author: Kaori Kaneko
articles.title: Japan household spending falls again in November, gloom may persist
articles.description: Japanese household spending fell for a second straight month in November and by more than forecast, suggesting that higher sales taxes may weigh on private consumption for sometime.
articles.content:
TOKYO (Reuters) - Japanese household spending fell for a second straight month in November and by more than forecast, suggesting that higher sales taxes may weigh on private consumption for sometime. 
The world’s third-largest economy is struggling to regain… [+2590 chars]

articles.author: Tatiana Bautzer
articles.title: SoftBank-backed delivery app Rappi lays off 6% of workers
articles.description: Latin American delivery startup Rappi said on Thursday it has laid off 6% of its workforce, less than a year after Japan's SoftBank Group <9984.T> invested nearly $1 billion in the company.
articles.content:
SAO PAULO/MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Latin American delivery startup Rappi said on Thursday it has laid off 6% of its workforce, less than a year after Japan’s SoftBank Group (9984.T) invested nearly $1 billion in the company. 
Rappi did not specify the number … [+1702 chars]

articles.author: Moira Warburton
articles.title: Canadians light candles to mourn victims of Iran plane crash
articles.description: Canadians held candlelight vigils in several cities on Thursday to remember 63 citizens killed in a plane crash in Iran, in what Canada's prime minister called a "tragedy that shocked the world."
articles.content:
TORONTO/EDMONTON, Alberta (Reuters) - Canadians held candlelight vigils in several cities on Thursday to remember 63 citizens killed in a plane crash in Iran, in what Canada’s prime minister called a “tragedy that shocked the world.”

articles.title: Golf: Reed's lawyer asks analyst Chamblee to back off critical comments

articles.author: Hideyuki Sano
articles.title: World stocks hit record high as techs lead relief rally
articles.description: The world's shares hit a record high on Friday as a relief over de-escalation of U.S.-Iranian tensions quickly prompted investors to bet on faster global growth, especially in the technology sector.
articles.content:
TOKYO (Reuters) - The world’s shares hit a record high on Friday as a relief over de-escalation of U.S.-Iranian tensions quickly prompted investors to bet on faster global growth, especially in the technology sector.

articles.title: Williams into semi-finals in windy Auckland
articles.description: Top seed Serena Williams overcame windy conditions to reach the semi-finals of the Auckland Classic on Friday with a 6-4 6-3 victory over Germany's Laura Siegemund.
articles.content:
WELLINGTON (Reuters) - Top seed Serena Williams overcame windy conditions to reach the semi-finals of the Auckland Classic on Friday with a 6-4 6-3 victory over Germany’s Laura Siegemund.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Britain advises against all travel to Iran
articles.description: Britain on Friday said it was advising against all travel to Iran as information suggested a Ukrainian airliner that crashed on Wednesday had probably been shot down by Iran.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Britain on Friday said it was advising against all travel to Iran as information suggested a Ukrainian airliner that crashed on Wednesday had probably been shot down by Iran. 
“Given the body of information that UIA Flight 752 was shot down by an… [+446 chars]

articles.author: Stanley White
articles.title: Japan shares rise as calming Middle East woes shift focus to trade deal
articles.description: Japanese shares rose on Friday, as demand for riskier assets increased buoyed by de-escalation of tensions in the Middle East and hopes that the Phase 1 U.S.-China trade agreement will boost corporate earnings.
articles.content:
TOKYO, Jan 10 (Reuters) - Japanese shares rose on Friday, as demand for riskier assets increased buoyed by de-escalation of tensions in the Middle East and hopes that the Phase 1 U.S.-China trade agreement will boost corporate earnings.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S. House passes war powers resolution
articles.description: Democratic House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says Congress must keep American people safe, as the House passes a resolution to stop President Donald Trump from further military action against Iran.
articles.content:
Posted 
Democratic House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says Congress must keep American people safe, as the House passes a resolution to stop President Donald Trump from further military action against Iran.

articles.title: Trump uses campaign rally to trumpet Soleimani killing as 'justice'
